- As we noted earlier, in his press conference on Aug. 31, Biden said troops had facilitated the evacuation of about 5,500 Americans before the last American troops left. “Now we believe that about 100 to 200 Americans remain in Afghanistan with some intention to leave,” he said. The men had made multiple trips abroad in the last year to discuss swap scenarios with Russian contacts. correction_response:
This tweet is misleading. While it's true that Paul Whelan, a Marine veteran, remains detained in Russia, it's not accurate to say he was "left behind enemy lines" by Biden. Whelan was detained in Russia since 2018, before Biden's presidency. The Biden administration has been actively working to secure his release, as evidenced by the negotiations for a prisoner swap involving Whelan. The term "stranded" also implies abandonment, which is not the case here. The U.S. government has classified Whelan as wrongfully detained and has been making efforts for his release. 
https://www.federaltimes.com/home/2022/12/08/wnba-star-freed-in-us-russia-prisoner-swap-marine-veteran-still-held/
note_1_text: Sen. Blackburn is referring to Paul Whelan, an  American business executive held by the Putin regime. The US is actively continuing negotiations for his release. He’s being treated more severely due to espionage accusations. His family has applauded Britney Griner’s release.   https://twitter.com/nickkalmanfn/status/1600847157216522240?s=46&t=-_BwBiVMjYEGGMZy7HvSrg  https://twitter.com/ap/status/1600852886900338688?s=46&t=-_BwBiVMjYEGGMZy7HvSrg
note_2_text: Mr. Whalen was given a bad conduct discharge from the Marines for various crimes. As such he no longer has the right to be called a Marine.  https://www.sportskeeda.com/pop-culture/why-paul-whelan-discharged-military-debate-ensues-amid-brittney-griner-release

refute_evidences: - Biden told ABC News unequivocally on Aug. 19 that the U.S. would not leave any Americans stranded. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/ap-fact-check-41a83656d872e2a5d5d79e18fffae6d7 published on 2021-08-31 22:40:00

- Whelan has been held in Russia since December 2018. The U.S. government also classified him as wrongfully detained. He was sentenced in 2020 to 16 years in prison. Whelan was not included in the Reed prisoner swap, escalating pressure on the Biden administration to ensure that any deal that brought home Griner also included him. Reference: https://www.federaltimes.com/home/2022/12/08/wnba-star-freed-in-us-russia-prisoner-swap-marine-veteran-still-held/ published on 2022-12-08 13:31:12

- Secretary of State Antony Blinken also has said that there are less than 200 Americans the U.S. still needs to get out of the country. “We believe there are still a small number of Americans, under 200 and likely closer to 100, who remain in Afghanistan and want to leave. We’re trying to determine exactly how many,” Blinken said in an Aug. 30 speech . Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2021/09/how-many-americans-and-allies-are-left-in-afghanistan/ published on 2021-09-02 20:00:56

- Even so, the fact that the deal was a one-for-one swap was a surprise given that U.S. officials had for months expressed their their determination to bring home both Griner and Paul Whelan, a Michigan corporate security executive and Marine veteran jailed in Russia since 2018 on espionage charges that his family and the U.S. government has said are baseless. Reference: https://www.federaltimes.com/home/2022/12/08/wnba-star-freed-in-us-russia-prisoner-swap-marine-veteran-still-held/ published on 2022-12-08 13:31:12

- “And if there are American citizens left, we’re going to stay until we get them all out.” The last U.S. planes took off from the airport Monday night, Aug. 30, one minute before midnight in Kabul. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/ap-fact-check-41a83656d872e2a5d5d79e18fffae6d7 published on 2021-08-31 22:40:00

- "“Since August the 14th, over an 18-day period, U.S. military aircraft have evacuated more than 79,000 civilians from Hamid Karzai International Airport,” Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr., commander of U.S. Central Command, said in an Aug. 30 press briefing . “That includes 6,000 Americans and more than 73,500 third-country nationals and Afghan civilians. This last category includes special immigrant visas, consular staff, at-risk Afghans and their families.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2021/09/how-many-americans-and-allies-are-left-in-afghanistan/ published on 2021-09-02 20:00:56
tweet_text: Joe Biden left a Marine stranded behind enemy lines.
